page.title: 04Lifestyles Public houses
page.content: 'The Fleece' pub was built in 1800. It is located in the village of Holme at Grid reference 108059. The walls are made of local sandstone and the roof is of stone flags. Outside the pub are picnic tables and benches. The pub carpark holds 20 cars at the back and five at the front. The pub stands on a busy road which leads over Holme Moss to Derbyshire. The sign outside shows a sheep's fleece hung up by a blue ribbon, they got the pubs name (The Fleece) from the sheep farms around the area. The most popular drinks in the pub are Lager and hand-drawn bitter beer. The pub serves bar snacks and has amusements in the form of a pool table and space invader machines.
